author: rsscno1
content: Hello everyone. I am a prospective PhD student and currently doing research on ETH storage reformation for gas saving. Now I am struggling to find the “most official” or “highest potential to be applied in further upgrades” implementation of Verkle Tree scheme. According to eip-6800, it seems to be a single-layer tree eventually? Whereas the codes inside eip-6800 describe a milti-layer Verkle Tree with branch width 256. I am confused which one is the preferred option? (or in fact eip-6800 is already discarded?)

author: dragan2836472
content: it could be due to this change: https://github.com/arkworks-rs/curves/pull/158#discussion_r1323172895

author: dragan2836472
content:
I have one question regarding how L2s (to be specific zkEVM type1) will work with verkle trie data structure:

- To my knowledge their goal is to recreate the same trie struct and "prove" that "edit" of the trie is done correctly, so having `state_root_1` and applying many (sparse) pedersen MSMs in the trie and proving that `state_root_2` is calculated correctly. Does this leave some space for additional optimization/aggregation of proving multiple same/similar MSMs? For example IPA multiproof proves and aggregates proofs for similar thing for verkle on L1 (membership proof) but here it's a bit different?

author: tr1.xxy
content: sorry but I couldn't really understand this

author: gottfriedherold
content: Hi <@810942641516707861> : You are using the point  G = ban(0x29C132CC2C0B34C5743711777BBE42F32B79C022AD998465E1E71866A252AE18,0x2A6C669EDA123E0F157D8B50BADCD586358CAD81EEE464605E3167B6CC974166) as a generator. These coordinates are only valid in *twisted Edwards* coordinates.

author: gottfriedherold
content: But you are using short Weierstrass form, so you need to also provide the generator in the appropriate coordinates for the *short Weierstrass* model.

author: gottfriedherold
content: The coordinate for the subgroup generator in Weierstrass coordinates are given by x = 0xa76451786f95a802c0982bbd0abd68e41b92adc86c8859b4f44679b21658710, y = 0x44d150c8b4bd14f79720d021a839e7b7eb4ee43844b30243126a72ac2375490a according to the Bandersnatch paper.

author: tr1.xxy
content: Okay this worked, thank you sm
